title: FOIL: Investor Agreements or Term Sheets

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request copies of all executed investor agreements, term sheets, invoices or membership agreements between Capitalize Albany Corporation and the following corporate "investors":

80 State Street
Albany Parking Authority
Albany Stadium Restaurant & Bar
Barton & Loquidice
Berkshire Bank
Blue House Companies
Brown & Weinraub
Business For Good
C.T. Male Associates
Cafe Capriccio
Capital Bank
Capital District YMCA
Capital Region Chamber of Commerce
Cass Hill Development
CBRE-Albany
Center For Economic Growth
CHA Consulting, Inc.
Columbia Development
Community bank
Community Loan Fund of the Capital Region
Community Preservation Corp.
Creighton Manning
Delaney Vero, PLLC
Downtown Albany Business Improvement District
Fairbank Properties
Gordon Companies
Greenbush Tape and Label
Harmony Group Capital
Harmony Mills South, LLC
Harris A. Sanders Architects
Harris Beach
Hershberg & Hershberg
Hodgson Russ, LLP
Holiday Inn Express, Albany
Jankow Companies
JNB Advisors, LLC
Kasselman Electric
LaBella Associates
McVeigh Funeral Home
Nigro Companies
Omni Development Company, Inc.
Picotte Companies
Pioneer Bank
Port of Albany
Redburn Development Partners
Renaissance Corp. of Albany
Richbell Capital
Rosenblum Companies
RSS Capital District
Saratoga National Bank
SEFCU
Sixty State Place
SMPR Title Agency
Stantec
SUNY Polytechnic Institute
The College of Saint Rose
Thomas M. Owens
Tri City Rentals
United Group of Companies
University at Albany
Vanguard-Fine
Whiteman Osterman & Hanna

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for Inception, Planning and Construction of Clinton Market Collective (Capitalize Albany Corporation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for the Construction of Clinton Market Collective

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I am requesting access to and copies of all invoices, itemized receipts, and financial records related to the inception, planning, design or construction of the Clinton Market Collective project located at 11 Clinton Avenue in Albany, New York. The construction of this project is supported by more than $3.5 million in local, state, and federal assistance.

The Clinton Market Collective project is being carried out by the following entities:

Schenectady-based landscape architecture firm PLACEAlliance as the designer.
Construction management services are being provided by TW&A.
Construction is being led by James H. Maloy, Inc.

The funding for this project comes from various sources, including the New York State Department of State, the City of Albany as part of its American Rescue Plan Act funding process, National Grid, and Capitalize Albany Corporation.

Please provide me with all invoices and itemized receipts for this project from its inception to the present. If any of the requested records cannot be disclosed, please cite the specific exemptions under FOIL and provide me with any segregable portion of the record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for Inception, Planning and Construction of Clinton Market Collective (City Of Albany)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for the Construction of Clinton Market Collective

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I am requesting access to and copies of all invoices, itemized receipts, and financial records related to the inception, planning, design or construction of the Clinton Market Collective project located at 11 Clinton Avenue in Albany, New York. The construction of this project is supported by more than $3.5 million in local, state, and federal assistance.

The Clinton Market Collective project is being carried out by the following entities:

Schenectady-based landscape architecture firm PLACEAlliance as the designer.
Construction management services are being provided by TW&A.
Construction is being led by James H. Maloy, Inc.

The funding for this project comes from various sources, including the New York State Department of State, the City of Albany as part of its American Rescue Plan Act funding process, National Grid, and Capitalize Albany Corporation.

Please provide me with all invoices and itemized receipts for this project from its inception to the present. If any of the requested records cannot be disclosed, please cite the specific exemptions under FOIL and provide me with any segregable portion of the record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker
